bug.author: knorthover
bug.summary: text_area Ctrl-Enter action does not update
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
The text_area box puts up a prompt message like "Ctrl-Enter" when done. This has no effect. Moving the mouse outside the box and left clicking applies the update and reruns the page regardless of whether Ctrl-Enter is used <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Create text_area widget and an st.write() for the output Enter some text Hit ctrl-enter
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Page runs and Value reported by st.write() <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
No effect Workaround is to click elsewhere on the page <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
That is, did this use to work the way you expected in the past? no <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 50.2 Python version: 3.7.3 Using Conda? for Python install, Pip for everything else OS version: Windows 10 Browser version: Chrome 78.0.3904.97
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
